conclusion: Electromagnetic aircraft launch is the most advanced catapult technology for aircraft carriers, and China has reached the world's advanced level in this field.
An interest group is conducting research on the design of an electromagnetic launch system.
The mover is insulated and fixed to the coil. The coil drives the mover, which can slide without friction on the horizontal rails. The coil is located in a radial magnetic field between the rails.
The magnitude of the magnetic flux density is B.
When switch S is connected to 1, the constant current source is connected to the coil.
The mover starts from rest, accelerating the aircraft. When the aircraft reaches takeoff speed, it detaches from the mover.
At this time, S is thrown to 2, connecting the fixed resistor R0.
Simultaneously, a retraction force F is applied. Under the action of F and the magnetic force, the mover returns to its initial position and stops.
The v-t diagram of the mover from rest to return is shown in Figure (2).
From time t1 to t3, F=(800-10v)N, and F is removed at t3.

It is known that the takeoff speed v1=80m/s, t1=1.5s, the number of turns of the coil is n=100, the circumference of each turn is l=1m, the mass of the aircraft is M=10kg, the total mass of the mover and coil is m=5kg, R0=9.5Ω, and B=0.1T.
Air resistance and the effect of aircraft takeoff on the mover's velocity are negligible.
To determine the current I of the constant current source, we need to analyze the motion of the mover during the acceleration phase and use the given information about the forces acting on the mover.

premise: The mover experiences a magnetic force due to the current in the coil and the magnetic field.
conclusion: The magnetic force FB on the mover is given by: FB = n B l I
Given: n = 100, B = 0.1 T, l = 1 m.
